+ WHITE & CASE SECURES DISMISSAL OF DEUTSCHE BAHN'S STUTTGART 21 COST OVERRUN LAWSUIT FOR STATE OF BADEN-W RTTEMBERG

Global law firmWhite & Case LLP has secured a victory for the State of Baden-Wurttemberg in the Administrative Court of Appeal of Baden-Wurttemberg, which rejected Deutsche Bahn's request to appeal a 2024 judgment by the Stuttgart Administrative Court related to the financing of the Stuttgart 21 project.

"At no point did the State of Baden-Wurttemberg assume any obligation to cover the cost overruns of the Stuttgart 21 project," said White & Case partner Henning Berger, who led the team which achieved the dismissals before both the Stuttgart Administrative Court and the Administrative Court of Appeal of Baden-Wurttemberg. "The state only made specific financial contributions under public subsidy law, as clearly and unambiguously defined in the financing agreement. The Administrative Court of Appeal has now confirmed this in its decision."

The Stuttgart Administrative Court had dismissed Deutsche Bahn's claim for approximately EUR7 billion in additional project costs against the State of Baden-Wurttemberg and other defendants relating to the financing of the Stuttgart 21 project. The decision of the Administrative Court of Appeal of Baden-Wurttemberg, which is final and cannot be appealed, establishes the Stuttgart Administrative Court's ruling as legally binding and definitively establishes that the State of Baden-Wurttemberg is not responsible for covering the significant cost overruns of the Stuttgart 21 project. Neither the so-called 'negotiation clause' in the Stuttgart 21 financing agreement, nor any other contractual or statutory basis, creates an obligation for the state to bear these additional costs in whole or in part

Source: Company Website

+ WHITE & CASE ADVISES SUMMIT PARTNERS ON INVESTMENT IN DREAMPATH DIAGNOSTICS

Global law firmWhite & Case LLP has advised leading growth-focused investment firm Summit Partners on its investment in Dreampath Diagnostics.

The investment will support the company's plans to accelerate global growth, scale operations and expand its commercial reach and product portfolio. As part of the transaction, two members of the Summit Partners team will join the Dreampath DiagnosticsBoard of Directors.

Dreampath Diagnostics is a global leader in digital sample management systems for anatomical pathology laboratories.

The White & Case team which advised on the transaction was led by partner Guillaume Vitrich (Paris) and included partners Alexandre Jaurett, Clara Hainsdorf, Orion Berg, Quirec de Kersauson, Brice Engel, Kami Haeri (all Paris), Hope Anderson (Los Angeles), David Bond, Farhad Jalinous (both Washington, DC), Jaye Kasper, Bethany Hills, Tal Marnin, Sasha Belinkie, Scott Fryman (all New York), Carlos Daroca (Madrid) and Alan Bao (Beijing), counsel Amanda Woodall (Houston), Katrin Helle (Berlin), Annie Anderson, Heidi Schmid (both New York) and Chris Thomas (London) and associates Nicolas Alfonsi, Marco Hladik, Matthieu Shamloo, Sarah Kouchad, Hovig Cancioglu, Olga Kosno, Louis Roussier, Pauline Abbouche, Gregoire Baudry, Clement Bellaclas, Mathilde Bernier, Dylan Deligny (all Paris), Benedict Tansey, Kyle Spencer, Alec Buchanan, Amanda Kingsley, Sam Ahmad (all London), Edward Ernst (New York), Allison Kepkay, Timothy Sensenig (both Washington, DC), Lucee Laursen (Chicago), Zixie Zhu (Beijing), Qianru Hong (Shanghai) and Joao Lacerda (London & Brussels).

+ BAKER MCKENZIE [3 Press Releases]

+ BAKER MCKENZIE PUBLISHES ANNUAL SUSTAINABILITY REPORT 2025

Leading global law firm Baker McKenzie has published its Annual Sustainability Report 2025, which provides an overview of the progress the Firm made in 2024 to advance its eight prioritized Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) and its broader sustainability strategy.

The report highlights Baker McKenzie's 2024 actions across key sustainability areas - spanning inclusion, diversity and equity, environmental impact, governance and the rule of law, and also reaffirms the Firm's commitment as a longstanding active participant of the UN Global Compact, upholding its Ten Principles on human rights, labor, the environment, and anti-corruption - and more broadly, its dedication to responsible business practices.

2024 was also the year of Baker McKenzie's 75th anniversary, and the Firm celebrated this milestone by demonstrating its deep commitment to local communities through a "Make a Difference Month" in July 2024.

Source: Company Website

+ BAKER MCKENZIE FIBRA NEXT ISSUES APPROXIMATELY USD 450 MILLION OF REAL ESTATE TRUST CERTIFICATES IN INITIAL PUBLIC OFFERING

Leading global law firm Baker McKenzie announced today that the New York office represented BofA Securities, BBVA, BTG Pactual and Goldman Sachs, as Global Coordinators, and Citigroup, J.P. Morgan, Morgan Stanley and Scotiabank, as joint bookrunners, in connection with an approximately USD 450 million initial public offering by Fibra Next. The offering of Real Estate Trust Certificates, also known as CBFIs (Certificados Bursatiles Fiduciarios Inmobiliarios), was offered publicly in Mexico on the Mexican Stock Exchange and was made internationally pursuant to Rule 144A and Regulation S.

The transaction represents the largest IPO in Mexico in almost a decade and one of the largest IPOs in Latin America in recent years.

Source: Company Website

+ BAKER MCKENZIE HIRES A NEW SPECIAL COUNSEL FOR ITS GROWING EMPLOYMENT LAW PRACTICE IN MELBOURNE

Baker McKenzie, in response to growth in its Melbourne Employment Law Practice has hired new Special Counsel, Marie Costa. Marie, previously at a large commercial firm, has extensive experience advising on regulatory matters, with a specialisation in workplace health and safety.

+ LINKLATERS LLP [3 Press Releases]

+ LINKLATERS ADVISES ON FINANCING OF ONE OF THE WORLD'S LARGEST OFFSHORE WIND FARMS

Linklaters has advised the lenders on the £3.6bn (EUR4.2bn) project financing of the East Anglia THREE offshore wind project, in one of the biggest offshore wind transactions of the last decade.

When the 1.4GW project, which is located off the Suffolk coast in the UK, comes into operation in Q4 2026, it will deliver enough clean energy to power 1.3 million British homes. In addition, over 2,300 jobs are expected to be created during construction, with 100 long-term roles supported across its lifetime.

Masdar and Iberdrola will each have a 50% stake and have co-governance of the asset, which will be pivotal in advancing Europe's ambitious offshore wind development targets.

Source: Company Website

+ LINKLATERS STRENGTHENS CORPORATE AND STRUCTURED LENDING PRACTICE WITH MEI LIAN

Linklaters has hired Mei Lian as a partner in its Corporate and Structured Lending practice in London, further strengthening its private capital and credit solutions offering.

Mei is a market leading specialist in credit solutions, with over 20 years' experience in high-end, cross-border finance transactions. Her expertise is navigating complex stressed and distressed situations, and she has a unique wide-ranging practice which spans the credit spectrum. In 2024, Mei was named in The Lawyer's Hot 100, and she was recognised among Financial News' '100 Most Influential Women in European Finance'. Earlier this year, she was recognised by Financial News as one of the 'Fifty Most Influential Lawyers in Europe'. Mei is also listed as a Leading Individual for Corporate Restructuring and Insolvency in the Legal 500 UK.

She joins from Paul Hastings where she was a partner in the Financial Restructuring practice and co-chair of the London office.

Source: Company Website

+ LINKLATERS ADVISES ON THE MILESTONE HOLDCO FINANCING BY ALSTRIA (BROOKFIELD)

Linklaters has advised the banks on the debut offering of senior secured notes by the holding companies of alstria office AG. The proceeds of the offering, totalling EUR300m, together with the EUR800m equity contribution from the shareholders, will be used to repay the acquisition bridge financing in connection with the LBO of alstria office AG by affiliates of Brookfield.

alstria Office AG (Brookfield) is a leading real estate company focused on acquiring, owning and managing a first class portfolio of office real estate in Germany.

The Linklaters high yield team was led by partner Giacomo Reali and included US associates Samy Amirouchen, Kristian Sutt, Juan Diego Tibaduiza and Makenna Cherry.

The team was also supported on banking matters by London partner Angus Graham, alongside managing associate Josh White and associate Riddhima Wahi.

Advice was also provided by Luxembourg partner Melinda Perera, together with senior managing associate Adrian Danciu, and associates Christoforos Naziroglou and Ana Fisticanu as to matters of Luxembourg law. Frankfurt partner Alex Schlee and counsel Wolfgang Ettengruber advised on German capital markets' aspects. London-based counsel Omer Harel advised on US tax law matters.

NYSE STOCK REPORT

AECOM Snapshot

AECOM Latest Earnings Highlights

Highlights of the Latest Earnings Report Q2 Fiscal 2025

AECOM posted adjusted earnings per share (EPS) of $1.25, exceeding forecasts by 8.7% and marking a 20% increase compared to the previous year.

Revenues experienced a decline year-over-year, though net service revenues (NSR) rose by 1%, reaching $742 million, supported by strong performance in the United Kingdom and Hong Kong markets.

Operating cash flow significantly increased by 102% to $191 million, while adjusted free cash flow surged by 141% to $178 million.

The company's total backlog climbed to $17.78 billion, compared to $17.38 billion during the same period last year, securing strong future revenue opportunities.

Guidance for fiscal 2025 was raised, with adjusted EPS projected between $5.10 and $5.20 and adjusted EBITDA between $1.180 and $1.210 billion, alongside NSR growth expectations of 5-8%.

Adjusted EBITDA margins are anticipated to improve by 30 basis points, ranging from 16.1% to 16.3%, with over 100% conversion from adjusted net income to free cash flow expected.

International revenues dropped by 3% to $875 million; however, operational improvements contributed to a margin expansion of 10 basis points, reaching 11.1%.

Analyst Commentary

Strong Margin Expansion and Operational Efficiency

Observers highlight AECOM's ongoing progress towards achieving its goal of a 17%-plus margin. This success is attributed to a strategic focus on high-margin markets and efficient project execution processes that enhance profitability.

Operational efficiency, supported by disciplined cost management, has enabled reinvestment into high-return initiatives, further strengthening long-term competitiveness.

Robust Cash Flow and Capital Allocation

Exceptional free cash flow growth of 141% underscores the company's healthy financial position. This robust cash flow supports disciplined strategies, including consistent share repurchases and annual dividend growth commitments exceeding 20%.

Resilient Backlog and Pipeline Growth

AECOM's record-breaking backlog of $17.78 billion and a book-to-burn ratio of 1.2x in its design business signify continued demand. The infrastructure and environmental sectors are noted as drivers propelling global growth opportunities.

Exposure to High-Growth Markets

Growth in strategic areas such as transportation, water, and environmental services positions AECOM to leverage rising global investments in sustainable infrastructure. Advancements in AI and digital technologies further highlight avenues for growth in high-demand segments.

Challenges in Revenue Growth and International Markets

Challenges persist as revenues declined year-over-year, with international performance impacted by currency fluctuations and market-specific factors. Nonetheless, the company's focus on organic growth initiatives provides strategic support against these challenges.

Optimism for Long-Term Prospects

Industry-wide optimism underscores AECOM's resilience and alignment with essential global trends such as urbanization and climate change. Its steady earnings growth and ability to mitigate economic uncertainties affirm confidence in its long-term trajectory.

Company Profile

AECOM is recognized as a global leader in infrastructure consulting services, offering comprehensive solutions in planning, design, engineering, construction management, and advisory sectors. The Americas represent its largest source of revenue, driven by transportation and water infrastructure projects involving design and construction management services. International segments also contribute notably to overall performance. Key growth areas include the Water and Environment Advisory business, propelled by the rising demand for sustainable solutions, and transportation design services, fueled by expanding global infrastructure investments. With a focus on high-margin operations and digital technology integration, the company continues solidifying its position as a leader in high-growth markets.

Activities

AECOM is a global infrastructure consulting firm headquartered in Los Angeles, California, providing professional services across various sectors. The company''s largest sources of revenue come from its Design and Consulting Services segment, which includes architecture, engineering, and planning for transportation, water, and environmental projects, and its Construction Services segment, which focuses on building and infrastructure construction management. These segments cater to both public and private clients, with significant contributions from government contracts in the United States and internationally. Among its fastest-growing areas, AECOM has seen notable expansion in its environmental and sustainability services, driven by increasing demand for climate resilience and green infrastructure solutions, as well as in digital consulting, leveraging technology for project efficiency. With a presence in over 150 countries, AECOM continues to strengthen its position as a leader in delivering comprehensive infrastructure solutions, adapting to global trends and client needs. It is the NYSE's 8th largest Construction company by market capitalisation.

AECOM PRESS RELEASES AND CORPORATE WIRE

August 11: AECOM selected to deliver project management and engineering services for The Avenues - Riyadh Phase II

AECOM (NYSE: ACM), the trusted global infrastructure leader, today announced it has been appointed by Shomoul Holding Company as the Project Management Consultant (PMC) and engineer for Phase II of The Avenues - Riyadh, a transformative mixed-use development in North Riyadh City, Saudi Arabia, following the successful delivery of The Avenues Phase I. The Avenues aims to be one of the most prominent commercial and investment destinations in the Middle East, elevating Saudi Arabia's position as a regional hub for business, innovation and lifestyle.

"We are honored that Shomoul Holding Company has entrusted us to extend our key role on The Avenues - Riyadh," said Hamed Zaghw, chief executive of AECOM's Middle East and Africa region. "This award is a testament to the transformational outcomes we are delivering for our clients across the Kingdom, and we are excited to shape a development that aligns with Vision 2030 and sets a new benchmark for mixed-use environments in the Middle East."

Valued at over $4 billion, the project spans 1,870,000 square meters of built-up area and 370,000 square meters of leasable area. It will include a luxury shopping mall and five towers featuring mixed-use functionalities such as hospitality, commercial and residential spaces. The Avenues - Riyadh is scheduled to open in early 2026.

"This appointment builds on our track record of delivering complex, high-profile developments that shape the cities of tomorrow," said Jason Kroll, chief executive of AECOM Arabia. "Our integrated team brings deep regional experience, digital delivery capabilities and industry-leading expertise in sustainability, and we look forward to collaborating with our partners to bring this world-class destination to life."

AECOM will deploy advanced digital project management tools, data-driven dashboards and lean construction methodologies to optimize project tracking, enhance stakeholder communications, and proactively mitigate risks-setting new standards for project delivery in the region.

NYSE STOCK REPORT

AECOM (NYSE:ACM), the NYSE's 8th largest Construction company by market cap, is up 13% Year to Date. There have been changes in analyst ratings and target prices in 2025 - some forward-looking and others that have been after price movements. Below are the recent analyst ratings changes and the change in company stock price since.

BairdOutperform to Outperform108 to 11817.125 Apr, 2025CitigroupBuy to Buy127 to 11623.816 Apr, 2025KeyCorpOverweight to Overweight121 to 10929.3

AECOM Snapshot

AECOM Latest Earnings Highlights

Highlights of the Latest Earnings Report Q2 Fiscal 2025

AECOM posted adjusted earnings per share (EPS) of $1.25, exceeding forecasts by 8.7% and marking a 20% increase compared to the previous year.

Revenues experienced a decline year-over-year, though net service revenues (NSR) rose by 1%, reaching $742 million, supported by strong performance in the United Kingdom and Hong Kong markets.

Operating cash flow significantly increased by 102% to $191 million, while adjusted free cash flow surged by 141% to $178 million.

The company's total backlog climbed to $17.78 billion, compared to $17.38 billion during the same period last year, securing strong future revenue opportunities.

Guidance for fiscal 2025 was raised, with adjusted EPS projected between $5.10 and $5.20 and adjusted EBITDA between $1.180 and $1.210 billion, alongside NSR growth expectations of 5-8%.

Adjusted EBITDA margins are anticipated to improve by 30 basis points, ranging from 16.1% to 16.3%, with over 100% conversion from adjusted net income to free cash flow expected.

International revenues dropped by 3% to $875 million; however, operational improvements contributed to a margin expansion of 10 basis points, reaching 11.1%.

Analyst Commentary

Strong Margin Expansion and Operational Efficiency

Observers highlight AECOM's ongoing progress towards achieving its goal of a 17%-plus margin. This success is attributed to a strategic focus on high-margin markets and efficient project execution processes that enhance profitability.

Operational efficiency, supported by disciplined cost management, has enabled reinvestment into high-return initiatives, further strengthening long-term competitiveness.

Robust Cash Flow and Capital Allocation

Exceptional free cash flow growth of 141% underscores the company's healthy financial position. This robust cash flow supports disciplined strategies, including consistent share repurchases and annual dividend growth commitments exceeding 20%.

Resilient Backlog and Pipeline Growth

AECOM's record-breaking backlog of $17.78 billion and a book-to-burn ratio of 1.2x in its design business signify continued demand. The infrastructure and environmental sectors are noted as drivers propelling global growth opportunities.

Exposure to High-Growth Markets

Growth in strategic areas such as transportation, water, and environmental services positions AECOM to leverage rising global investments in sustainable infrastructure. Advancements in AI and digital technologies further highlight avenues for growth in high-demand segments.

Challenges in Revenue Growth and International Markets

Challenges persist as revenues declined year-over-year, with international performance impacted by currency fluctuations and market-specific factors. Nonetheless, the company's focus on organic growth initiatives provides strategic support against these challenges.

Optimism for Long-Term Prospects

Industry-wide optimism underscores AECOM's resilience and alignment with essential global trends such as urbanization and climate change. Its steady earnings growth and ability to mitigate economic uncertainties affirm confidence in its long-term trajectory.

Company Profile

AECOM is recognized as a global leader in infrastructure consulting services, offering comprehensive solutions in planning, design, engineering, construction management, and advisory sectors. The Americas represent its largest source of revenue, driven by transportation and water infrastructure projects involving design and construction management services. International segments also contribute notably to overall performance. Key growth areas include the Water and Environment Advisory business, propelled by the rising demand for sustainable solutions, and transportation design services, fueled by expanding global infrastructure investments. With a focus on high-margin operations and digital technology integration, the company continues solidifying its position as a leader in high-growth markets.

These segments cater to both public and private clients, with significant contributions from government contracts in the United States and internationally. Among its fastest-growing areas, AECOM has seen notable expansion in its environmental and sustainability services, driven by increasing demand for climate resilience and green infrastructure solutions, as well as in digital consulting, leveraging technology for project efficiency. With a presence in over 150 countries, AECOM continues to strengthen its position as a leader in delivering comprehensive infrastructure solutions, adapting to global trends and client needs. It is the NYSE's 8th largest Construction company by market capitalisation.

AECOM Snapshot

AECOM Latest Earnings Highlights

Highlights of the Latest Earnings Report Q2 Fiscal 2025

AECOM posted adjusted earnings per share (EPS) of $1.25, exceeding forecasts by 8.7% and marking a 20% increase compared to the previous year.

Revenues experienced a decline year-over-year, though net service revenues (NSR) rose by 1%, reaching $742 million, supported by strong performance in the United Kingdom and Hong Kong markets.

Operating cash flow significantly increased by 102% to $191 million, while adjusted free cash flow surged by 141% to $178 million.

The company's total backlog climbed to $17.78 billion, compared to $17.38 billion during the same period last year, securing strong future revenue opportunities.

Guidance for fiscal 2025 was raised, with adjusted EPS projected between $5.10 and $5.20 and adjusted EBITDA between $1.180 and $1.210 billion, alongside NSR growth expectations of 5-8%.

Adjusted EBITDA margins are anticipated to improve by 30 basis points, ranging from 16.1% to 16.3%, with over 100% conversion from adjusted net income to free cash flow expected.

International revenues dropped by 3% to $875 million; however, operational improvements contributed to a margin expansion of 10 basis points, reaching 11.1%.

Analyst Commentary

Strong Margin Expansion and Operational Efficiency

Observers highlight AECOM's ongoing progress towards achieving its goal of a 17%-plus margin. This success is attributed to a strategic focus on high-margin markets and efficient project execution processes that enhance profitability.

Operational efficiency, supported by disciplined cost management, has enabled reinvestment into high-return initiatives, further strengthening long-term competitiveness.

Robust Cash Flow and Capital Allocation

Exceptional free cash flow growth of 141% underscores the company's healthy financial position. This robust cash flow supports disciplined strategies, including consistent share repurchases and annual dividend growth commitments exceeding 20%.

Resilient Backlog and Pipeline Growth

AECOM's record-breaking backlog of $17.78 billion and a book-to-burn ratio of 1.2x in its design business signify continued demand. The infrastructure and environmental sectors are noted as drivers propelling global growth opportunities.

Exposure to High-Growth Markets

Growth in strategic areas such as transportation, water, and environmental services positions AECOM to leverage rising global investments in sustainable infrastructure. Advancements in AI and digital technologies further highlight avenues for growth in high-demand segments.

Challenges in Revenue Growth and International Markets

Challenges persist as revenues declined year-over-year, with international performance impacted by currency fluctuations and market-specific factors. Nonetheless, the company's focus on organic growth initiatives provides strategic support against these challenges.

Optimism for Long-Term Prospects

Industry-wide optimism underscores AECOM's resilience and alignment with essential global trends such as urbanization and climate change. Its steady earnings growth and ability to mitigate economic uncertainties affirm confidence in its long-term trajectory.

Company Profile

AECOM is recognized as a global leader in infrastructure consulting services, offering comprehensive solutions in planning, design, engineering, construction management, and advisory sectors. The Americas represent its largest source of revenue, driven by transportation and water infrastructure projects involving design and construction management services. International segments also contribute notably to overall performance. Key growth areas include the Water and Environment Advisory business, propelled by the rising demand for sustainable solutions, and transportation design services, fueled by expanding global infrastructure investments. With a focus on high-margin operations and digital technology integration, the company continues solidifying its position as a leader in high-growth markets.

Activities

AECOM is a global infrastructure consulting firm headquartered in Los Angeles, California, providing professional services across various sectors. The company''s largest sources of revenue come from its Design and Consulting Services segment, which includes architecture, engineering, and planning for transportation, water, and environmental projects, and its Construction Services segment, which focuses on building and infrastructure construction management. These segments cater to both public and private clients, with significant contributions from government contracts in the United States and internationally. Among its fastest-growing areas, AECOM has seen notable expansion in its environmental and sustainability services, driven by increasing demand for climate resilience and green infrastructure solutions, as well as in digital consulting, leveraging technology for project efficiency. With a presence in over 150 countries, AECOM continues to strengthen its position as a leader in delivering comprehensive infrastructure solutions, adapting to global trends and client needs. It is the NYSE's 8th largest Construction company by market capitalisation.

AECOM PRESS RELEASES AND CORPORATE WIRE

August 11: AECOM selected to deliver project management and engineering services for The Avenues - Riyadh Phase II

AECOM (NYSE: ACM), the trusted global infrastructure leader, today announced it has been appointed by Shomoul Holding Company as the Project Management Consultant (PMC) and engineer for Phase II of The Avenues - Riyadh, a transformative mixed-use development in North Riyadh City, Saudi Arabia, following the successful delivery of The Avenues Phase I. The Avenues aims to be one of the most prominent commercial and investment destinations in the Middle East, elevating Saudi Arabia's position as a regional hub for business, innovation and lifestyle.

"We are honored that Shomoul Holding Company has entrusted us to extend our key role on The Avenues - Riyadh," said Hamed Zaghw, chief executive of AECOM's Middle East and Africa region. "This award is a testament to the transformational outcomes we are delivering for our clients across the Kingdom, and we are excited to shape a development that aligns with Vision 2030 and sets a new benchmark for mixed-use environments in the Middle East."

Valued at over $4 billion, the project spans 1,870,000 square meters of built-up area and 370,000 square meters of leasable area. It will include a luxury shopping mall and five towers featuring mixed-use functionalities such as hospitality, commercial and residential spaces. The Avenues - Riyadh is scheduled to open in early 2026.

"This appointment builds on our track record of delivering complex, high-profile developments that shape the cities of tomorrow," said Jason Kroll, chief executive of AECOM Arabia. "Our integrated team brings deep regional experience, digital delivery capabilities and industry-leading expertise in sustainability, and we look forward to collaborating with our partners to bring this world-class destination to life."

AECOM will deploy advanced digital project management tools, data-driven dashboards and lean construction methodologies to optimize project tracking, enhance stakeholder communications, and proactively mitigate risks-setting new standards for project delivery in the region.

August 11: AECOM selected to deliver project management and engineering services for The Avenues - Riyadh Phase II

AECOM (NYSE: ACM), the trusted global infrastructure leader, today announced it has been appointed by Shomoul Holding Company as the Project Management Consultant (PMC) and engineer for Phase II of The Avenues - Riyadh, a transformative mixed-use development in North Riyadh City, Saudi Arabia, following the successful delivery of The Avenues Phase I. The Avenues aims to be one of the most prominent commercial and investment destinations in the Middle East, elevating Saudi Arabia's position as a regional hub for business, innovation and lifestyle.

"We are honored that Shomoul Holding Company has entrusted us to extend our key role on The Avenues - Riyadh," said Hamed Zaghw, chief executive of AECOM's Middle East and Africa region. "This award is a testament to the transformational outcomes we are delivering for our clients across the Kingdom, and we are excited to shape a development that aligns with Vision 2030 and sets a new benchmark for mixed-use environments in the Middle East."

Valued at over $4 billion, the project spans 1,870,000 square meters of built-up area and 370,000 square meters of leasable area. It will include a luxury shopping mall and five towers featuring mixed-use functionalities such as hospitality, commercial and residential spaces. The Avenues - Riyadh is scheduled to open in early 2026.

"This appointment builds on our track record of delivering complex, high-profile developments that shape the cities of tomorrow," said Jason Kroll, chief executive of AECOM Arabia. "Our integrated team brings deep regional experience, digital delivery capabilities and industry-leading expertise in sustainability, and we look forward to collaborating with our partners to bring this world-class destination to life."

AECOM will deploy advanced digital project management tools, data-driven dashboards and lean construction methodologies to optimize project tracking, enhance stakeholder communications, and proactively mitigate risks-setting new standards for project delivery in the region.

NYSE STOCK REPORT

AECOM's share price is continuing to underperform that of Stantec. AECOM's return over the past 3 months has been 13.7% and Stantec's return has been 15.6% over the same period.

AECOM Snapshot

AECOM Latest Earnings Highlights

Highlights of the Latest Earnings Report Q2 Fiscal 2025

AECOM posted adjusted earnings per share (EPS) of $1.25, exceeding forecasts by 8.7% and marking a 20% increase compared to the previous year.

Revenues experienced a decline year-over-year, though net service revenues (NSR) rose by 1%, reaching $742 million, supported by strong performance in the United Kingdom and Hong Kong markets.

Operating cash flow significantly increased by 102% to $191 million, while adjusted free cash flow surged by 141% to $178 million.

The company's total backlog climbed to $17.78 billion, compared to $17.38 billion during the same period last year, securing strong future revenue opportunities.

Guidance for fiscal 2025 was raised, with adjusted EPS projected between $5.10 and $5.20 and adjusted EBITDA between $1.180 and $1.210 billion, alongside NSR growth expectations of 5-8%.

Adjusted EBITDA margins are anticipated to improve by 30 basis points, ranging from 16.1% to 16.3%, with over 100% conversion from adjusted net income to free cash flow expected.

International revenues dropped by 3% to $875 million; however, operational improvements contributed to a margin expansion of 10 basis points, reaching 11.1%.

Analyst Commentary

Strong Margin Expansion and Operational Efficiency

Observers highlight AECOM's ongoing progress towards achieving its goal of a 17%-plus margin. This success is attributed to a strategic focus on high-margin markets and efficient project execution processes that enhance profitability.

Operational efficiency, supported by disciplined cost management, has enabled reinvestment into high-return initiatives, further strengthening long-term competitiveness.

Robust Cash Flow and Capital Allocation

Exceptional free cash flow growth of 141% underscores the company's healthy financial position. This robust cash flow supports disciplined strategies, including consistent share repurchases and annual dividend growth commitments exceeding 20%.

Resilient Backlog and Pipeline Growth

AECOM's record-breaking backlog of $17.78 billion and a book-to-burn ratio of 1.2x in its design business signify continued demand. The infrastructure and environmental sectors are noted as drivers propelling global growth opportunities.

Exposure to High-Growth Markets

Growth in strategic areas such as transportation, water, and environmental services positions AECOM to leverage rising global investments in sustainable infrastructure. Advancements in AI and digital technologies further highlight avenues for growth in high-demand segments.

Challenges in Revenue Growth and International Markets

Challenges persist as revenues declined year-over-year, with international performance impacted by currency fluctuations and market-specific factors. Nonetheless, the company's focus on organic growth initiatives provides strategic support against these challenges.

Optimism for Long-Term Prospects

Industry-wide optimism underscores AECOM's resilience and alignment with essential global trends such as urbanization and climate change. Its steady earnings growth and ability to mitigate economic uncertainties affirm confidence in its long-term trajectory.

Company Profile

AECOM is recognized as a global leader in infrastructure consulting services, offering comprehensive solutions in planning, design, engineering, construction management, and advisory sectors. The Americas represent its largest source of revenue, driven by transportation and water infrastructure projects involving design and construction management services. International segments also contribute notably to overall performance. Key growth areas include the Water and Environment Advisory business, propelled by the rising demand for sustainable solutions, and transportation design services, fueled by expanding global infrastructure investments. With a focus on high-margin operations and digital technology integration, the company continues solidifying its position as a leader in high-growth markets.

Activities

AECOM is a global infrastructure consulting firm headquartered in Los Angeles, California, providing professional services across various sectors. The company''s largest sources of revenue come from its Design and Consulting Services segment, which includes architecture, engineering, and planning for transportation, water, and environmental projects, and its Construction Services segment, which focuses on building and infrastructure construction management. These segments cater to both public and private clients, with significant contributions from government contracts in the United States and internationally. Among its fastest-growing areas, AECOM has seen notable expansion in its environmental and sustainability services, driven by increasing demand for climate resilience and green infrastructure solutions, as well as in digital consulting, leveraging technology for project efficiency. With a presence in over 150 countries, AECOM continues to strengthen its position as a leader in delivering comprehensive infrastructure solutions, adapting to global trends and client needs. It is the NYSE's 8th largest Construction company by market capitalisation.

AECOM PRESS RELEASES AND CORPORATE WIRE

August 05: AECOM Collaborates on $200M White House Ballroom Project

The White House has announced plans for a significant expansion project, appointing Clark Construction and AECOM to design and build a new state ballroom. The project, valued at $200 million, will feature a 90,000-square-foot ballroom that aligns with the architectural heritage of the existing White House, according to Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt. This announcement was made on 5th August 2025 and is set to enhance the White House's capacity for hosting events.

The new ballroom will replace the current East Wing and is designed to accommodate 650 guests, a considerable increase from the East Room's current capacity of 200. Press Secretary Leavitt emphasized that the ballroom will be "innately designed and carefully crafted," ensuring that its theme and architectural style closely mirror that of the main building. AECOM, recognized as the top design firm in the Engineering News-Record's 2025 rankings, will play a critical role in the engineering aspects of this project.

Construction is expected to commence in September, with the completion timeline anticipated to fall well within President Trump's current term. The East Wing, originally built in 1902 and expanded in the 1940s, will undergo modernization as part of this initiative. During construction, staff currently located in the East Wing will be temporarily relocated to facilitate the work, which aims to preserve the historical significance of the White House while enhancing its functionality.

Jim McCrery, CEO of McCrery Architects, which is part of the project team alongside AECOM, expressed commitment to maintaining the elegance and classical design of the White House. The project has garnered funding commitments from President Trump and unspecified private donors, reinforcing its importance to the administration.
